cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles ESE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest just offshore the Florida coast, then turning north-northwest and north-northeast toward the Georgia and Carolina coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina / North Carolina border (between Myrtle Beach SC and Cape Fear NC)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of South Santee River SC to Surf City NC (Tropical Storm Watch); Edisto Beach SC to Cape Fear NC (Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hallandale Beach FL to South Santee River SC (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from Florida through the Carolinas and up the Mid-Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) likely Monday night into early Tuesday with gusts that could reach minimal hurricane strength in squalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground level possible along the lower Cape Fear River and adjacent beaches, especially at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–5 inches of rain with isolated amounts up to 7 inches could cause flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes possible Monday night; dangerous surf and rip currents beginning Monday.
